ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A main type is a STRING which indicates, whether a building_element_component is the main component of a building_element. This shape is modified through the additions_and_subtractions to give the final shape of the Building_element. The predefined value of the main is one of the following:
main
not_main
The value main indicates, that the positive_component is the main component of the Building_element.
The value not_main indicates, that the positive_component is not the main component of the Building_element, but an addition.
A opening_name specifies a descriptive title, which may be assigned to an building_element_component.

An opening_functional_type specifies a descriptive label that indicates the form or function of the Opening by a predifned value. The predefined value of the opening_functional_type is one of the following:
door_opening
service_opening
window_opening
The value door_opening indicates that the opening is in a wall that it is intended to provide access from one side of the wall to the other and may be filled with a door.
The value service_opening indicates that the opening is in a wall, floor, or roof that it is intended to allow service elements to pass through the wall, floor, or roof.
The value window_opening indicates the opening is in a wall or roof of a building to admit light and usually to provide visual access through the wall or roof.
An opening_type specifies a descriptive label that indicates the form or function of the Opening. The value is either user defined or predefined.

A Building_element_component is a basic compositional constituent of the shape of Building_element object that can imply a functional role. A Building_element_component is either a Positive_component or a Negative_component. A column consists of the components shaft, brackets, and openings.

A Negative_Component is a type of Building_element_component that is a portion of a Building_element and represents a volume of space; it is a volume that is empty space rather than solid material. A Negative_component may be one of the following: a Recess or an Opening. The shape of a Negative_component is of concern only where it intersects a Positive_component. A Negative_component in a wall could be a door opening. The relationship between the Negative_component (the door opening) and the Positive_component (the wall) is the same as if the shape of the Negative_component were subtracted using a solid boolean operation (a CSG solid modelling operation) from the shape of the Positive_component.

An Opening is a type of Negative_component that passes through a Building_element and serves a functional purpose. An opening would be left in a wall or slab for plumbing or air conditioning ducts. The data associated with an Opening are the following:
The opening_type specifies a descriptive label that indicates the form or function of the Opening. The value is either user defined or predefined.

A Positive_component is a type of Building_element_component (see 4.2.11) that represents a solid volume. A Positive_component in a wall could be a window sill. The relationship between the Positive_component representing the sill and the Positive_component representing the wall is the same as if the shape of the positive_component representing the sill were added to the Positive_component representing the wall using a solid boolean operation (a CSG solid modelling operation).
The component_functional_type specifies a descriptive label that indicates, whether the Positive_component is the main component of the Building_element.
A Recess is a type of Negative_component (see 4.2.40) that does not pass through a Building_element (see 4.2.10). An alcove or niche in a wall are recesses.
